channel.title: Help with my staff list [Please atleast look at]
channel.description: Okay this probably wont be a easy task and maybe its alot easier than it looks but im asking for a big favor i need somebody to explain how to make this happen. Right here is a picture of my staff list at the minute. [IMG]http://i39.tinypic.com/35i59xd.png[/img] Now i would like to make it so that to the right of player names it displays online if online or offline if offline much like friends list please somebody help im terrible at client sided help.

item.title: Help with my staff list [Please atleast look at]
item.dc:creator: @Jacob5 Jacob_
item.description:
@Jacob5 wrote:

Why an event or sticking it inside of the servers process method? Couldn’t you simply update the String when a player that is on the staff list has logged out, or logged in? Seem’s much more robust.

Read full topic
item.source: Help with my staff list [Please atleast look at]

item.title: Help with my staff list [Please atleast look at]
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

Jacob_:

@Superman, why in process? Isn’t that called regularly on a tick of some sort? Why couldn’t you put the ‘online / offline’ snippets under where the player is terminated & where the player is initialized?

either process or use an event whenever the player has logged in, i don’t care honestly, done with PI so.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with my staff list [Please atleast look at]
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

private boolean isOnline(String name) { for(Player p : PlayerHandler.players) { if(p != null) { if(p.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(name)) return true; } } return true; }
change it to

private boolean isOnline(String name) { for(Player p : PlayerHandler.players) { if(p != null) { if(p.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(name)) return true; } } return false; }

I forgot that part, but I edited on the first post, but it was too late.

Read full topic

src\server\model\players\Client.java:1933: missing return statement } ^ Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. 1 error Press any key to continue . . .
Made it

private boolean isOnline(String name) { for(Player p : PlayerHandler.players) { if(p != null) { if(p.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(name)) return true; } } return true; }
but now its showing vinnie online and hes not online

item.source: Help with my staff list [Please atleast look at]

item.title: Help with my staff list [Please atleast look at]
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

Good. Now you can write the [online] and [offline] tags.

Try something like this:

Note: I am spoonfeeding, so you just need to figure out where to put this (preferably somewhere in the Client file).

getPA().sendFrame("Justin ["+(isOnline("Justin") ? @gre@ online : @red@ offline)+"] ", 17004);
getPA().sendFrame("Vinnie ["+(isOnline("Vinnie") ? @gre@ online : @red@ offline)+"] ", 17005);

If they have another username that they go by on the server, then just simply change the “Justin” to whatever.

The method

private boolean isOnline(String name) {
for(Player p : PlayerHandler.players) {
if(p != null) {
if(p.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(name))
return true;
}
}
return false;
}

Read full topic
